reviews.sentence: Location. Room did not seem updated some holes in wall and bed uncomfortable.

Great location hotel needs updates. Great location. Needs drastic updating in rooms. Dust was terrible in the room bathroom and vents. Toilet seat was peeling. Air conditioner did work for the 90 degree days.

Old and tired hotel in need of a renovation. Even if the hotel it is in a central location rooms are so updated. hallway are dark and looked scary rooms more than a deep cleaning need a complete renovation. Booked the room at a whooping 78 a night but I definitely will not stay here again.
Locationrom is like 60 years old and needs repair.

Great Location 2 Star Hospitality. Excellent location. If the owners seriously invested into the hotel it would be great. Staffing levels poor for the volume of business and market mix. Needs to consider people travelling from overseas etc. Can not at least register prior to check in time of 150. You find this out after waiting 40 minutes in a line. Express check in computers is great. I recommend it. But you need the hotels confirmation number to access it. My agent booking reference of course would not work. Someone did come and help. If you arrive early you need to store bags. This comes at a price of 5 per bag. Tickets are to be bought at the reception desk the one with the big line. My room was old and tired. Bed sheets were clean as well as bathroom linen. Room furniture old and tired and the Bathroom itself requires refurbishment. Old half peeled sticker on the wall etc. Lovely hot water but can not use tub as it looks gross. Sound proofing to the next room is poor. On check out there was a huge line. Wanted to use the Express Check out and store luggage. Went to the Bell Captain and learnt I needed to buy the luggage tickets at the reception desk. Seriously. Back in the line I went. On check out the GSA processes your bill without letting you see it first. I discovered I was over charged 40. I returned in the afternoon and had this corrected. Look. I understand NYC is expensive but the lack of service with sloppy processes and poor bathroom quality is no excuse. I will say that the 2 gentleman in the luggage room downstairs that you have to look for were excellent. I would suggest management have a chat with them as they were the only accommodating staff without looking for a tip that I had met. Yes I later tipped them because they deserved it.

Watch out not to stay in non renovated room. Location They have taken 250 deposit and gave as a non renovated room looks like a cell not a hotel room very dirty i had to leave straight away see pic i included.

Hotel Pennsylvania made our stay in New York. The beds were comfortable and always well made. The location is a virtual boon enabling us to get practically everywhere without a hassle. We were very appreciative that a bag left in a taxi when we signed out was subsequently recovered and delivered to a relative all with the hotels assistance. A bit more care could have been taken with the cleaning and general preparation of the room. The property is not new but maintenance of the room and fittings would go a long way to improve its appeal.

I love New York this great location but facilities rooms need vastly improving. Location is the best part about the hotel. Room I first received was disgusting had flies damp patches etc when spoke with staff I got a new better room more to what I saw online but should not have needed to complain. Room was dirty had flies in the bathroom no view from window at all hotel looks like it needs a refurb throughout not as good as the picture that it shows online very disappointed with that.
Location. Could do with a wee revamp.
Fair. Location. Hotel was very grubby needs a major update. would not stay again.

Think twice before booking. Location onlyWe had to queue for more than an hour to check in. Then we were given an old room probably from 1900s. Everything was so aged broken dirty. There was so much dust and dirt everywhere and room window could not be closed which caused all the noise and cold to come inside the room. We stayed in that room for a night and asked for a room change. Then they gave us another old room which was more dirtier urine spreaded all over the toilet. We asked for another room and finally they gave us one of the refurbished rooms. But entire experience was tiring and terrible.
It was very disgusting and it needs to be completely tore down and renovated. The bathroom the halls the bed rooms.

Poor. The location is great the only good thing about this place. Easy access to the subway just across the stet. The room was horrific extremly bad smell and in desperate need of a renovation. Felt more like a sunken motelrom. The wait for the elevators was up to 20 minutes and you did not fancy taking the steep stairs with all your luggage. do not understand the logic of only getting 2 breakfastcoupons when we booked a room for 4 people. Has potential but needs a LOT of renovation before being good standard.

Penn room nice stay. Classic room. NO WAY. We started in a classic room. It was dated dirty uncomfortable. Yes we saw a cockroach run under the door of a room in our hall. We asked to see if we could upgrade to one of the redone updated Penn rooms. Unfortunately the hotel was booked but the manager told us to come back the next morning. The next morning we went back to the same manager who was wonderful and asked if we could upgrade. She said she was holding some rooms expecting us to come back. We waited while she found us a room that had been cleaned and was ready for us to switch to. I asked her how much for the upgrade and she said “ I ’m not going to charge you you are just too nice ”. Our upgraded Penn room was very nice and we enjoyed the rest of our stay. We happened to be there during the World Pride March so the hotel was extremely busy. I believe there are over 170 rooms. There are 12 elevators and we never had to wait for an elevator. The breakfast was about a block away at a restaurant. They were very prepared for the hotel guests and I had a huge fresh fruit cup and wonderful pastry each day we went there. The location of this hotel was perfect for the things we wanted to do. Penn Station and Madison Square Garden are directly across the street. I would stay here again but would MAKE SURE I booked a remodeled Penn room. I WOULD NOT stay in one of the classic rooms again.

Poor. The location is very good. First room we were given was so horrid we immediately asked to be moved to another. It was damp and dirty. When at reception it was noticed there was a list the receptionist had of room moves that day and when we said what room we were in she nodded her head as if she expected it. Clearly we were not the only ones to complain that day. 2nd room was tolerable and only accepted as could not upgrade that night to a newly refurbished room. Next morning managed to upgrade to a refurbished room these rooms are ok to stay in but not what they are advertised as. The cracks have only been painted over literally when it came to the bathroom. The carpet was coming up at the edge the windows and curtains are still not clean and carpet has not been replaced just cleaned a little better than on other floors. The breakfast can hardly be called that a pastry and melon everyday at a cafe down the road not what was expected. Some staff were pleasant but others where indifferent. If you have time to cancel your room at this hotel I would I would never recommend or stay here again.

The long wait for check in the carpeting was disgusting smell old and had wholes. The air conditioner wet up the carpet and it smell damp the door was ancient and the locks. The hotel had so many customers you would think they would renovate.

This hotel was not worth the money that I paid. The hotel is very run down and the rooms where SO disappointing. For being such a famous hotel they are in need of a major renovation. The sink was clogged the bathroom shower has chipped paint all over the tub. The sheets look like they have never been replaced since the hotel opened. The place is worth 50 dollars a night and that is being nice. I did not even want to go back to the hotel after being out. It was not a good experience going back to a dingy room.

very bad and unclean hotel very very old zero maintenance. very high price for this place. Extremely smelly carpets very very expensive rates. Very disatisfiedcleanlines. No fridge in one of the rooms. lights were fused not working.
Good. Renovation of hotel rooms. Staff wants to make money from everything.

Location is great and the only reason i would ever stay here again. Took us about 90 minutes to check in. automatic kiosks were out of order stood in line for an hour then stood at counter for 30 minutes while the girl checking us in kept refreshing her screen waiting for a cleaned room to become available for us. we have had a reservation for months. Then the room we got backed up to the elevators on the wall where our headboard was. We heard banging and creaking from the elevators all day and night constantly. The bathtub was not usable as the finish was cracking and peeling and the shower needed to be turned on to full hot and left running for about 15 minutes to warm up to where it was barely lukewarm. Never had a hot shower in 4 days. The coffee shop in the lobby is cash only who carries cash.
I will never go to this place again. only the location is perfect. Dirty room bathroom. Very bad breakfast. Hotel need entire renovation. Careless customer service.
Alright stay with good location. Good location decent sized rooms for New York the bed was comfortable. The rooms and hotel need to be updated everything just seems so old.

Too expensive for such old hotel it needs to be renovated and refurbished. Great location in the centre of Manhattan close to metro and walking distance to different attractions and landmarks. Hôtel very old carpet in the room and corridor are dirty and worn. The doors are very old and cracked. Staff are rude and not welcoming at the café where we had breakfast.

Good. Check in staff at the hotel was very accommodating. No further comments. Traveling with family and small children there were no facilities such as kettle or refrigerator in the room. When addressed to the Front Desk staff was informed that it was a safety hazard to have kettles in the room. DISAPPOINTED you was referred by the Front desk staff to purchase hot water to make formula for my baby which would cost me 20 at the hotel property. Restaurant was under renovation and had to walk 2 blocks fo have breakfast with 3 options for Continental breakfast. Lost one of my coupons and the female front desk staff was not accommodating she repeatedly said that I was issued 6 vouchers i told her that i was not disputing the fact however 1 voucher was lost. In the Customer service. NO APOLOGIES. It almost became and argument. Additionally each room should have a desk and chair especially when catering to business travelers.

Somewhat disapointing form the outside the hotel looks nicer than it is. The art deco style of the hotel. The fact that the downstairs toilets had not been renovated in many years did make them rather interesting. The lifts were reliable and the cleaning staff were friendly. Breakfast okay but a bit of a walk away although it looked like the hotel had facilities on the premises. The room looked as though it had received no maintenance in many years. Desk staff dismissive and sour. Constant noise from a generatorDriping faucet in the bath room. Insufficient.

Nice. The location is one of the best things about this hotel. The staff was friendly and nice. I stayed for one night in one of the basic rooms. Nothing fancy about it. Before picking this location I read that some rooms were outdated and that the upper floors have the renovated ones. I payed for the basic one so I was on the 3rd floor and I did not expect anything but the basic. The room was spacious but old. I am hoping that they would also end up renovating that section of the hotel because it was kind of weird having multiple doors inside the room at first. The carpet was not on the best conditions or anything but overall if you are not picky and want a place to just crush at night you wo n’t mind. The bed was comfortable and breakfast was included. For the price though I would suggest that they offer better or more breakfast options. Instead of just coffee one pastry and a fruit juice. Overall great location nice helpful staff and basic rooms if you pay for the cheapest one.

Pleasant. It ’s old and not all remodeled it seems dated need a lot work on it a great location but it ’s need to be remodeled. It does n’t seems remodeled it look really not taking care of the hotel it look old.

Ask for a modernized room. Wait lines 20 minutes to check in. Half the building is runs down and feels like it has not been updated since the 1940s. When I complained 20 minutes line told to come back later to see manager they freely gave us a better updated room which was acceptable for the good price.
Rats inside the hotel. The facilities are very old and lack of maintenance. They give the same breakfast every day.
